title: U vs x graphs - identifying features

content.question: A system consists of several objects that interact with each other by conservative forces. One of the objects is free to move only in the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-direction, while the other objects are fixed in space. The potential energy of the system as a function of the position of the moveable object is shown. Which of the following statements is true?

choices.label: The mechanical energy of the movable object in the region shown can never be greater than <math alttext="2 joules" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mtext>2 J</mtext></mstyle></math>.
There are <math alttext="3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn></math> positions of stable equilibrium for the movable object in the region shown.

The speed of the movable object is greatest at position <math alttext="x equals x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

The acceleration of the movable object will be positive in the region between <math alttext="x equals x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="x equals x sub 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>3</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.

content.answer: The speed of the movable object is greatest at position <math alttext="x equals x sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><msub><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></mstyle></math>.
